title: Ticket #2890: BOSCO shell independent setup
description:
After usability test by Alain became evident that users don't know which shell they use and need a single setup file.

Users will type source ~/bosco/boscosetup

This will use 3 files:

  • boscosetup - shell independent script
  • shellselector - detects the shell used and selects the appropriate setup file
  • shell dependent setup file (sh/csh version provided)

boscosetup will be something like: 

# shell independent setup
# replace the installation directory (default is $HOME/bosco)
source $HOME/bosco/bosco.`$HOME/bosco/shellselector -q`

shellselector is: 

#!/bin/bash
# shellselector by Marco Mambelli, marco@hep.uchciago.edu
# Expects the parent process to be a shell and provides its name
# Used to select a shell dependent setup from an insependent one:
# source setup.`./shellselector -q`
# Without "-q" it prints informations about the shell detected
#
# Test show that $SHELL is unreliable
# Current shell is preferrable to the login shell
#
if [ "X${1}X" == "X-hX" ]
then
 echo "$0 [-h|-q]"
 echo "         detects a shell and shell family"
 echo " -h      prints this help message"
 echo " -q      quiet, prints only the shell family (sh or csh)"
 exit
fi

MYSHELL="`ps -o ppid= -p $$ | xargs ps -o comm= -p `"
# change the case statement below to have different setup files for ksh or zsh
case "$MYSHELL" in
 bash|sh) SHELLFAM="sh";;
 ksh) SHELLFAM="sh";;
 zsh) SHELLFAM="sh";;
 tcsh|csh) SHELLFAM="csh";;
 *) if [ "X${1}X" == "X-qX" ]
    then SHELLFAM="sh"
    else echo "Unknown shell $MYSHELL"; exit 1
    fi;;
esac
if [ "X${1}X" == "X-qX" ]
then echo "$SHELLFAM"
else echo "Your shell is $MYSHELL, of type $SHELLFAM"
fi

bosco.sh and bosco.csh are generated at the installation

This code has been tested. It has to be added to the release
remarks:
2012-Mar-19 15:14:58 by marco:
This is an additional modification of the setup scripts.

The usability test showed a problem on clusters with multiple hosts behind balancing. The solution here takes care of that checking if the setup is sourced on the host where the install script was launched. There is a new script checking that and the 2 setup scripts are modified. All 3 follow here. I don't know exactly how bosco.sh (condor.sh) or bosco.csh (condor.csh) are created so I did not modify the source code.

An alternative could be to modify bosco.sh and bosco.csh to include the content of bosco_check_host. I have no preference between the 2 options.

bosco_check_host: 

#!/bin/bash
# checks that a directory ~/bosco/local.$HOST exists
# to verify that bosco has been installed on the correct host
install_host=`ls -d $HOME/bosco/local.* | xargs basename | cut -f2 -d.`
current_host=`hostname | cut -f1 -d.`
echo "Here $install_host and are on $current_host"
if [ "$install_host" != "$current_host" ]; then
    echo "Bad host. You installed BOSCO on $install_host and are on $current_host." >&2
    exit 1
fi

bosco.sh (I added few lines on top): 

# The script should be sourced by /bin/sh or similar
/share/home/marco/bosco/bosco_check_host
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then return 1
fi
CONDOR_CONFIG="/share/home/marco/bosco/etc/condor_config"
export CONDOR_CONFIG
PATH="/share/home/marco/bosco/bin:/share/home/marco/bosco/sbin:$PATH"
export PATH

bosco.csh (I added few lines on top): 

# The script should be sourced by /bin/csh or similar
/share/home/marco/bosco/bosco_check_host
if ( $? != 0 ) then
    exit 1
endif
setenv CONDOR_CONFIG "/share/home/marco/bosco/etc/condor_config"
setenv PATH "/share/home/marco/bosco/bin:/share/home/marco/bosco/sbin:$PATH"
